message_1: Solve the inequality 2x - 3 > 7 and graph the solution on a number line.
message_2:
To solve the inequality 2x - 3 > 7, follow these steps:

Step 1: Add 3 to both sides of the inequality.
2x - 3 + 3 > 7 + 3
2x > 10

Step 2: Divide both sides by 2.
2x / 2 > 10 / 2
x > 5

The solution to the inequality is x > 5.

To graph the solution on a number line:

1. Draw a number line with an open circle at 5 (since x is strictly greater than 5 and not equal to 5).
2. Shade the region to the right of the open circle, indicating that all values greater than 5 are part of the solution.

The graph will look like this:

<---(5)--->
       ^
       |
    Open circle at 5, shaded region to the right
